item.title: Consolations
item.description: Re-read 11/24 â€“ 12/24. I picked this up last month after [[books/forest of noise|Forest of Noise]], when a full year of ongoing genocide seemed to pass without fanfare. Despair is a necessary and seasonal state of repair, Whyte writes. It takes us in when we have nowhere else to go; when we feel the heart cannot break anymore.
